bugs.title: CVE-2016-10369 lxterminal: Insecure use of /tmp for a socket file [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-10369 lxterminal: Insecure use of /tmp for a socket file [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-10369 lxterminal: Insecure use of /tmp for a socket file

long_desc.thetext:
unixsocket.c in lxterminal through insecurely uses /tmp for a socket file, allowing a local user to cause a denial of service (preventing terminal launch), or possibly have other impact (bypassing terminal access control).

References:

https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/333539/lxterminal-in-the-netstat-output/333578

Upstream patch:

https://git.lxde.org/gitweb/?p=lxde/lxterminal.git;a=commit;h=f99163c6ff8b2f57c5f37b1ce5d62cf7450d4648

Created lxterminal tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1449114]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2017-8934 pcmanfm: Insecure temporary file creation in get_socket_name function [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-8934 pcmanfm: Insecure temporary file creation in get_socket_name function [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-8934 pcmanfm: Insecure temporary file creation in get_socket_name function

long_desc.thetext:
Insecure temporary file creation in get_socket_name function was found leading to potential access violation.

Upstream patch:

https://git.lxde.org/gitweb/?p=lxde/pcmanfm.git;a=commitdiff;h=bc8c3d871e9ecc67c47ff002b68cf049793faf08

Acknowledgments:

Name: Mamoru Tasaka

Created attachment 1279069
Fix potential access violation, use runtime user dir instead of tmp dir.

Note: it limits libmenu-cache compatibility to menu-cached >= 0.7.0.

Upstream patch:
https://git.lxde.org/gitweb/?p=lxde/menu-cache.git;a=commit;h=56f66684592abf257c4004e6e1fff041c64a12ce
https://github.com/lxde/menu-cache/commit/56f66684592abf257c4004e6e1fff041c64a12ce
http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q2/260

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by mtasaka.

bug.title: CVE-2016-10369 lxterminal: Insecure use of /tmp for a socket file [fedora-all]

comments.text: This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
A potential security flaw is found on LXDE products, which create socket under /tmp with some predictable names, which may leads to DOS. The security flow on lxterminal is now assigned as  CVE-2016-10369. Some other components also had similar issues.  
These new rpms should fix these issues.  

At least relogin is required to make this fix effect.
title: lxterminal-0.3.0-3.fc25 menu-cache-1.0.2-4.D20170514git56f6668459.fc25 pcmanfm-1.2.5-2.fc25
